title.value: Posterior Sampling of the Initial Conditions of the Universe from Non-linear Large Scale Structures using Score-Based Generative Models
title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Posterior Sampling of the Initial Conditions of the Universe from Non-linear Large Scale Structures using Score-Based Generative Models

extractions.description: This research paper discusses a novel approach for reconstructing the initial conditions of the universe using score-based generative models. By training a neural network to predict the score of the posterior distribution with simulations from the Quijote Latin Hypercube set, the researchers propose a method for efficiently sampling realizations of the early universe from present-day observations. The results indicate that the proposed method is capable of providing accurate and fast reconstructions of the early universe.

type.justification: The paper involves experiments and simulations to verify the quality of the proposed method using statistical and cosmological data, therefore classifying it as an empirical study.
type.quote: In this work, we propose the use of score-based generative models to sample realizations of the early universe given present-day observations. We infer the initial density field of full high-resolution dark matter N-body simulations from the present-day density field and verify the quality of produced samples compared to the ground truth based on summary statistics.
